name: Atta Galatta presents “AG Book Club” - Monthly Book Club with Palgun KJ
description:
What have you been reading? Come, discuss your latest read. Each member gets 5-7 minutes to talk about the book, theme, plot, with 2 minutes to answer any questions others might have. This month’s special focus will be philosophy- come tell us what you've been reading.
December’s special focus will be books on Philosophy/ Self Help/ Motivational

name: The Store Of Life - Book Reading Session by Shruthi Harikrishna
description:
At the supermarket, you fill your basket to get the most for your money. At the Store of Life, you fill your basket to get the most out of your time, the one truly finite resource.
At this book-reading session, we’ll explore a few chapters together, try out some simple activities, and reflect on what we choose to carry with us. As you spend your most important currency, your time, with me, I hope to fill your life basket with a little bit of joy, clarity, and purpose.
This event is free of charge, but it is “charged” in that precious currency of time.
Whether you're struggling to say no, trying to find balance, hoping to create space for what matters, or curious about the compounding power of small habits, there’s something here for you.
Told through simple doodles and gentle reflections, the book invites you to pause, pick wisely, and carry only what brings joy, peace, and purpose. You can flip through it lightly, dip into it occasionally, or explore it deeply - whatever your heart desires.
So… what will you choose to carry with you?
And if you can, do join the session. It would fill my basket with joy.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup by The Listeners Circle
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup by ADHD Queeple
description:
The next dates for Queer Quiet Hours are here!  Register here - http://bit.ly/adhdqueeple

Queer Quiet Hours is back — a cozy space to rest, make art, and just be. No pressure to talk, no need to perform. Just soft community vibes and gentle company. Bring your own project or come as you are. We'll have plenty of art stuff for you to use.
✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.
 
📅 14th December
Sunday, 2:00 - 5:00 PM
📍 @attagalatta, Indiranagar, Bangalore
🆓 Free to join. Limited spots ( Sign up)
📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

name: A Story Walk Through Domlur - Story Walk by Vikram Sridhar
description:
On a Saturday morning , Walk through the lanes of DOMLUR , from lores dating back in time from the Madras Presidency , Mysore State to the current IT , Banking and Retail sectors with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore , Heritage and Ecology of the rich area which is identified as a village. The walk will begin from Bhandutvas , a theatre collective , and culminate at the Bangalore International Centre . The tales will revolve around historical , mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.
*Date* : 20th December   ( Saturday)  2025
 *Time* : 7 AM
 *Starting Point* : Atta Galatta
Registration : 350/ per person 
Ticket Link : https://in.bookmyshow.com/plays/a-story-walk-through-domlur-bangalore/ET00465609
(or) 
Details and GPAY : 9945799224

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk by Vikram Sridhar
description:
On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.
*Date* : 20 December
 *Time* : 10 AM
 *Starting Point* : Atta Galatta
Registration : 350/ per person 
Ticket Link : https://in.bookmyshow.com/plays/a-story-walk-through-indiranagar-bangalore/ET00387939
(or) 
Details and GPAY : 9945799224

name: Food In Literature - Book Club with Prachi Grover
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well. 
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
December Read: The Evin Prison Bakers' Club by Sepideh Qolian
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. 
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who love to read and eat!
When: Saturday, 20th December, 2025 at 11 a.m.
Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira Nagar
Ages: 18+
Registration is mandatory (link in bio)
Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: Four Voices, One Celebration - Book Launch Celebration by Inner Healing Oasis
description:
Join us for a morning of inspiration, healing, and heartfelt storytelling as Inner Healing Oasis Publishing proudly presents the launch of four remarkable books — each offering a unique perspective on growth, resilience, and the human journey.
On 20th December 2025, from 11:00 AM to 1:30 PM, the iconic Atta Galatta Bookstore in Bengaluru will host this special gathering — uniting four diverse authors whose words resonate with truth, transformation, and hope.
Meet the Authors and Their Books
I’m a Fresher, I’m Confused by Zahed Ali A witty, heartfelt story that captures the struggles and aspirations of a young man stepping out of college and into the fast-paced world of the IT industry. Honest and humorous, it reflects the confusion, courage, and self-discovery of a generation finding its way.
Heal with Melody by Shweta Saimy A soulful guide to using sound, rhythm, and vibration as pathways to healing. Through the language of music and emotion, this book helps readers reconnect with inner harmony and find balance through self-expression.
Her Second Spring by Dr. Sameer Paranjape A compassionate and empowering book that brings to light the emotional, physical, and social experiences of women navigating menopause. It is a celebration of the strength, wisdom, and renewal that mark a woman’s “second spring” in life.
Rewriting Destiny by Sanjib Chowdhury A transformative exploration of quantum healing and human consciousness. Sanjib blends science and spirituality to reveal how we can transcend limiting beliefs and consciously shape our destiny.
 
An Event to Inspire and Connect
This multi-author launch is more than a literary gathering — it’s a celebration of stories that heal, empower, and ignite conversation. Meet the authors, listen to their journeys, experience live readings, and be part of a morning that celebrates creativity, courage, and community.
We are also honored to have industry experts from relevant fields gracing the event with their presence — adding depth, dialogue, and fresh perspectives to the conversation.
Come witness the moment where ink meets energy, and stories come alive.
 
Venue: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indiranagar, Bengaluru
Date: 20th December 2025
Time: 11:00 AM – 1:30 PM
Hosted by: Inner Healing Oasis (IHO)

name: ❄️✨ Winter pages, warm hearts, and the soft magic of stories… ✨❄️ - AG Lit Sisters Thematic Book Club
description:
The AG Lit Sisters are closing the year with a beautifully cozy December gathering: Snowflakes & Storytelling!
Think twinkling lights, favourite winter reads, shared laughter, and the joy of being surrounded by bookish soul-sisters. 💙📚
📅 December 20, 2025
⏰ 1:30–3:00 PM
📍 Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
☕ Coffee on the house for everyone!
 
Entry is FREE but online registration is mandatory, and we have only 20 slots. First come, first seated!
Bring your favourite winter story, your festive cheer, and your warmest energy. Let’s make it a December to remember. 🌨️✨
❓ Question of the Day:
Which book gave you the coziest winter feeling this year?

name: No Pressure Improv returns - An improv open mic by No Pressure Improv
description: No Pressure Improv returns with the Improv & Sketch Open Stage - think open mics, but for improv (and sketch)! Come watch Bengaluru's bubbling improv scene every month, and sign up if you will, to flaunt your improv on the Open Stage! Up to 8 performers who sign up are put together on the Open Stage to play improv together, led by the jam-master of the evening. This is a great opportunity to get stage time and to play improv in front of a kind and supporting audience, who will be alongside you as you improvise and discover the make-believe. 40 minutes of Open Stage is followed by a featured act in the second half. Bring your ensemble or solo act, improv or otherwise - whether it's storytelling or stand-up or spoken word or your original set of songs - it's the perfect stage for you to experiment with your act or present it to the community.

name: Lahe Lahe Caravan presents Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup by Sonali Bhatia
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle - Book Launch by Priyanka Kumar
description:
In an era where Gen Zs and millennials seek meaning through experiences rather than possessions, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle – Stories of Friendships & Adventures in Nature offers exactly the kind of soulful escape today’s young adventurers crave. For those who live for spontaneous road trips, mountain treks, beach escapades, and serendipitous conversations with strangers—and secretly nurture the hope of finding love and companionship along the way—Priyanka Kumar’s latest collection is a deeply relatable read. With its mix of short stories and memoir-style reflections, this book resonates with those who believe that real connection and personal discovery often happen far away from the familiar.
The newest installment in Priyanka’s celebrated People’s Kafe series, Whispers from the Lighthouse of Galle brings together heartfelt stories and travel-infused memories that capture the healing magic of nature and the unspoken bonds we form with people and places. Though it’s not a travelogue in the conventional sense, the book reads like one—with vivid glimpses into landscapes and emotions that stay with the reader long after they turn the final page.
And yet, the book is as much about the people as it is about the places. There are tales of peacocks who roamed her childhood garden like kin, strangers-turned-friends on spontaneous journeys, and even encounters that subtly hint at love blossoming when least expected. The presence of love—gentle, unforced, and organic—is a quiet undercurrent in a couple of these stories, offering a warm, relatable thread for every romantic dreamer who has ever looked out of a train window and wondered, what if?

name: Let Poetry Be - Poetry Open Mic by Palgun K. J.
description:
This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!
Date: 27th December
Time: 4pm 
Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar
 
Event specifics & submission guidelines –
1. Theme - Free Verse (any original work)
2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live
3. All languages welcome
4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes
5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time
6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 25th Dec midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for-December LPB meet-up'
7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme
8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host
9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.com
You are now welcome to flood our inbox!
